item.title: Report E-2025020103
item.description:
Report E-2025020103

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-07
  • City: SAN LORENZO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 7, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN3264 was crushed in transit and released approximately eight (8) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the site. The crew transferred the contents into one (1) new 275-gallon tote. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report X-2025020368
item.description:
Report X-2025020368

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-07
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Steven Kow, 155 Operations Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a UN129 Isopropanol spill on the dock floor. Steven Kow advised the freight being improperly loaded and not blocked or braced. Steven Kow stated the freight was crushed by other freight causing the spill. Safety advised Steven Kow tha t CURA will be contacted for remediation. Reagan Cowdrey with Cura was contacted for remediation.

item.title: Report X-2025020435
item.description:
Report X-2025020435

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-06
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. 1 fiberboard box containing 2 metal cans @ 4L each, leaking from the cap/tops. The cans were loaded on its sides inside of the box. Markings on the metal cans: VARN International, VWM 4G Case (4G=1PC) Flint Group, KV25-005-01BC, QC@5870350 The shipper provided the SDS Shipment is being held for FAA Investigation.

item.title: Report X-2025020432
item.description:
Report X-2025020432

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-05
  • City: RANCHO CORDOVA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Feb 5th during the PM sort a package was rattled and the sound of aerosol cans was observed. There were no indications on the outside of the package indicating and dangerous goods. when opened several aerosol cans were inside the package, UN1950 aerosols, flammable, 2.1. The package is being held pending investigation.

item.title: Report E-2025020129
item.description:
Report E-2025020129

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-17
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 16500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal ULA experienced a release of UN1830 AcidPro S93 from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 40-gallons of product spilled due to a pallet nail puncture. The material impacted a 25' x 8' area of the trailer floor, and the concrete lot below in areas measuring 25' x 7 and 30' x 20'. Soda ash and absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents, neutralizer, pallet pieces, PPE, impacted debris, and the damaged original drum were collected and containerized into (11) poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025020097
item.description:
Report E-2025020097

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-10T06:19:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-29
  • City: TUSTIN
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 29, 2025, a Veolia employee was loading drums into a trailer at Eurofins. The employee used a drum dolly to move the 55 gallon plastic drum into the trailer. Once the employee placed the drum dolly down, the side of the drum cracked and started to spill. Approximately 2 gallons of liquid spilled from the drum. The drum was immediately leaned on its side to prevent additional liquid from spilling. A pump was used to transfer the contents of the leaking drum into a new drum for transportation. The spill was cleaned with absorbent.

item.title: Report I-2025010090
item.description:
Report I-2025010090

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-10T06:19:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-27
  • City: Los Angeles
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Delta's DG Management Group was notified of a lithium battery overheat event during flight of DL771/27Dec2024 (JFK-LAX). A passenger's power bank overheated resulting in a fire. A responding Flight Attendant was able to contain the fire using water. The Fire Department was called and put the item in the lithium-ion containment bag. A passenger's hand was burned but declined medical assistance. The NRC and FAA were notified.

item.title: Report E-2025020032
item.description:
Report E-2025020032

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-07
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 06:57 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (UBY) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper packaging, approximately 1 gallon of Sodium Hydroxide - Nu-Brite Cleaner (hazardous - UN3266) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor at dock door #85. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of UN3266 Sodium Hydroxide product released to a 6’ x 6’ area of the trailer floor and a 4’x4’ area on the wall of the trailer due to the cap of the tote popping off. The top was replaced, and it was ensured it was seated properly. Sodium Bicarbonate solution was used to neutralize the impacted areas. Contractors containerized impacted rags, PPE and poly sheeting into (1) 55-gallon poly. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
